task.summary: Corrected the coordinate system, texcoords still weird.
Started development on the collision detection system by making a size system for objects.
Created an arraylist of all world objects to check collisions with the player against.

-Successfully created a collision detection system! -Modified the TexturedModel class to return a new Vector3f for its position instead of a reference. This way, doing operations, like normalization, on the Vector3f doesn't modify the TexturedModel's real position. -Added some minor Javadoc comments to Main. -Fixed some warnings.
Created a list of 200 obstacles. Runs perfectly even if checking for collisions for every single obstacle. Removed star imports.
Added world generator that adds Obstacle's based on red channel in an image. Bugs: Occasionally, the collision checker returns null.
Added two new textures. Also removed prööh a couple commits back.

Successfully converted everything, including collision detection to the new coordinate system! Collision detection now only works between game objects and the player. (It's going to take a while before other creatures get added :p) Collisions now use AABBs. Was thinking about adding support for multiple AABBs (One for each TexturedModel of an Entity, Would require relative coords). Added a logger with three levels: ERROR, WARNING, INFO. JavaDoc is completely screwed up everywhere.
